required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cricoid Pressure vs. Paralaryngeal Pressure to Prevent Regurgitation
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Effects of Cricoid Pressure and Paralaryngeal Pressure to Prevent Regurgitation of Gastric Contents

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing the effects of ' Cricoid pressure' or 'Paralaryngeal pressure' during endotracheal intubation procedure.

detailed_description.textblock:
Applying Cricoid pressure is widely used procedure to prevent gastric contents regurgitation during endotracheal intubation. To find out effectiveness external pressure is applied, the investigators will evaluate the relative position of esophagus and trachea. And also comparing the effects of Cricoid pressure and Paralaryngeal pressure during whole tracheal intubation procedures.
1. Confirm the relative positions between esophagus and trachea in awake patients by using ultrasonography.
2. Compare the effect of 'Cricoid pressure' and 'Paralaryngeal pressure' to esophageal opening during tracheal intubation procedure as below points.
1) Awake states. (Before sedation) 2) Anesthetized states. (After muscle relaxation) 3) During direct intubation procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Occlusion of esophagus is checked under the application of cricoid and paralaryngeal pressures during direct laryngsocpy

secondary_outcome.measure: The relative position of the upper esophageal end to the glottis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute before and after the induction of anesthesia, during direct laryngoscopy
secondary_outcome.description: The position assessed by using ultrasonography and direct visualization

secondary_outcome.measure: The outer anteroposterior diameter of the upper esophageal end
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 1 minute in awake and anesthetized paralyzed states
secondary_outcome.description: The outer anteroposterior diameter of the upper esophageal end is assessed before and durng the application of cricoid and paralaryngeal pressures.
POGO score under the application of cricoid and paralaryngeal pressures

study_pop.textblock: Who has any surgery under general anesthesia and agree with the purpose of the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Who would be scheduled any surgery under general anesthesia and agree with the purpose of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diseases or anatomical abnormalities in the neck, larynx, pharynx or esophagus,
- Aspiration tendency
- Known or predicted difficult airway.

facility.name: Seoul Metropolitan Government Seoul National University Boramae Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate professor, Department of Anesthesiology and Pain medicine
